concept_definition: used to connect words, phrases, clauses, or sentences to indicate addition or combination (e.g., "apples and oranges", "She sang and he danced").
used to link alternatives or choices, indicating that one or the other (or both) of the connected items is possible (e.g., "tea or coffee").
used to introduce a phrase or clause contrasting with what has already been said; however
used to indicate accompaniment, manner, possession, or instrumentality; e.g., "She came with her friend," "Cut the bread with a knife."
(preposition) Not having; lacking. Example: "She left without her keys."  (conjunction) Except that; if not. Example: "He did it without anyone helping."

used to indicate the purpose or intended recipient of something (e.g., "a gift for you"); used to indicate duration (e.g., "for two hours"); used to indicate support or benefit (e.g., "for the team"); used to indicate reason or cause (e.g., "apologize for being late").
indicating the point in space or time at which a person or thing starts or originates; used to show separation or source (e.g., "She came from Paris", "open from 9 AM")

introducing the phrase or clause that follows; used to indicate the point in time or place at which something happens or the condition under which something is true (e.g., "in the morning", "in case of emergency")

(preposition) Physically in contact with and supported by a surface; resting atop. Example: "The book is on the table." (adverb) Indicating a state of operation or continuation. Example: "The lights are on." (adjective) Functioning or operating. Example: "The machine is on."
used to indicate a specific time, place, direction, or target (e.g., at 5 o'clock; at the station; look at the sky; laugh at someone).

to (preposition): expressing motion in the direction of or reaching toward a place, person, or thing (e.g., "walk to the store").

to (infinitival particle): used before the base form of a verb to form the infinitive (e.g., "to run").
used to indicate the subject or topic of a discussion or statement; on the subject of (e.g., "a book about medieval history").
for the reason that; since; used to introduce a clause giving the cause or reason for something
Introducing a conditional clause that expresses a possible situation or supposition on which something else depends (e.g., “If it rains, we will stay inside.”).
introducing a result or consequence; therefore; as a result (used to connect a cause with its effect)
at that time; consequently; in that case — used to refer to a time or to indicate a result or logical consequence (e.g., "We arrived then", "If you're ready, then let's go").
introducing a clause that expresses purpose, result, or reported content; used to connect clauses (e.g., "She said that she was coming"; "He worked hard so that he could succeed").
expressing the relationship between a part and a whole; belonging to or associated with (e.g., "a page of the book", "a member of the team"); indicating possession or origin.
used to indicate comparison or manner; in the same way that; while; because (e.g., "She sang as she worked", "As you know...", "do as I say").
expressing movement or direction toward the inside of a place or thing (e.g., "walk into the room"); expressing transformation or change (e.g., "turn into ice").
indicating the agent in a passive construction (e.g., "written by an author"); indicating proximity (e.g., "sit by the window"); indicating means or method (e.g., "travel by train").
moving in one side and out the other; from one end to the other of (e.g., "walk through the door"); by means of (e.g., "learn through experience"); during (e.g., "through the night").
extending above or higher than; across the surface of; more than (e.g., "jump over the fence", "talk over coffee", "over ten people").
introducing the second element in a comparison (e.g., "taller than her brother", "more quickly than expected").
extending or directly below; beneath; less than; subject to (e.g., "under the table", "under ten dollars", "under his control").
on; on top of (more formal than 'on'); immediately after (e.g., "sit upon the throne", "once upon a time", "upon arrival").
in opposition to; in contact with; contrary to (e.g., "lean against the wall", "fight against injustice", "against my wishes").
from one side to the other of; on the opposite side of (e.g., "walk across the street", "across the river").
in the space separating two things; in the interval separating two points in time (e.g., "between the buildings", "between noon and evening").
from a specified time until now; because; seeing that (e.g., "since yesterday", "since you asked").
at a higher level or layer than; more than (e.g., "above the clouds", "above average").
surrounded by; in the company of; in the midst of (e.g., "among friends", "among the trees").
in the direction of; with regard to; for the purpose of (e.g., "walk toward the door", "feelings toward someone", "save toward a goal").
inside; not beyond the limits of; in or into the interior of (e.g., "within the house", "within reach", "within an hour").
at the side of; next to; compared with (e.g., "sit beside me", "beside the point").
at or to the further side of; more than; surpassing (e.g., "beyond the mountains", "beyond comprehension", "beyond our budget").
up to the point in time or the event mentioned; till (e.g., "wait until tomorrow", "until we meet again").
despite the fact that; although; however; even if (e.g., "though it was raining", "strange though it may seem").
during the time that; at the same time as; although; whereas (e.g., "sing while you work", "while I agree...").
